intro: Soroseris qinghaiensis, commonly known as the Qinghai soroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai region of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
